main_text:
The nature of species is controversial in biology and philosophy.
Biologists disagree on the definition of the term
‘species,’ and philosophers disagree over the ontological
status of species. Yet a proper understanding of species is important
for a variety of reasons. Species are the fundamental taxonomic units
of biological classification. Environmental laws are framed in terms
of species. Even our conception of human nature is affected by our
understanding of species. This entry discusses a number of
philosophical issues concerning biological species.
